org.opends.server.replication.protocol

Class ErrorMsg

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.replication.protocol.ReplicationMsg
      • org.opends.server.replication.protocol.RoutableMsg
        • org.opends.server.replication.protocol.ErrorMsg

  • public class ErrorMsg
extends RoutableMsg
    This message is part of the replication protocol. This message is sent by a server or a replication server when an error is detected in the context of a total update.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.opends.server.replication.protocol.RoutableMsg

        sender - The server ID of the server that send this message.
        destination - The destination server or servers of this message.
        details - The message containing the details of the error.

      • ErrorMsg

        public ErrorMsg(byte[] in,
        short version)
         throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Creates a new ErrorMsg by decoding the provided byte array.
        Parameters:
        in - A byte array containing the encoded information for the Message
        version - The protocol version to use to decode the msg.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - If the in does not contain a properly encoded message.

        public byte[] getBytes(short version)
        Serializes the PDU using the provided replication protocol version. WARNING: should be overwritten by a PDU (sub class) we want to support older protocol version serialization for.
        Specified by:
        getBytes in class ReplicationMsg
        Parameters:
        version - The protocol version to use for serialization. The version should normally be older than the current one.
        Returns:
        The encoded PDU.

      • getCreationTime

        public java.lang.Long getCreationTime()
        Get the creation time of this message. When several attempts of initialization are done sequentially, it helps sorting the good ones, from the ones that relate to ended initialization when they are received.
        Returns:
        the creation time of this message.
